alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; New Kent; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chesterfield, northwestern Charles City, northwestern New Kent, Henrico, southeastern Hanover and northeastern Dinwiddie Counties, the City of Richmond and the City of Colonial Heights through 215 PM EDT... At 125 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tuckahoe to Chesterfield Court House to near Matoaca. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chester, Bon Air, University Of Richmond and Tuckahoe around 130 PM EDT. Virginia Union University and Bellwood around 135 PM EDT. Richmond, Laurel, Lakeside and Bensley around 140 PM EDT. Hopewell, Mechanicsville, Virginia Commonwealth University, Downtown Richmond, Glen Allen and East Highland Park around 145 PM EDT. Randolph Macon College around 150 PM EDT. Ashland and Highland Springs around 155 PM EDT. Hanover and Kings Dominion around 200 PM EDT. Studley around 205 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Richmond Heights, Addison, Gum Tree, Mountcastle, Elko, Elmont, Montrose, Sandston, Glendale and Westwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; New Kent; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William
